abstract: In the lucrative business of underwriting and selling a company’s stock, J.P. Morgan led the world’s banks this year, earning an estimated $2.2 billion in fees, or nearly double what it hauled from the deals last year.
snippet: In the lucrative business of underwriting and selling a company’s stock, J.P. Morgan led the world’s banks this year, earning an estimated $2.2 billion in fees, or nearly double what it hauled from the deals last year.
lead_paragraph: In the lucrative business of underwriting and selling a company’s stock, JPMorgan led the world’s banks this year, earning an estimated $2.2 billion in fees, or nearly double what it hauled from the deals last year.

headline.main: JPMorgan Tops Rankings, With $2.2 Billion In Fees

abstract: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, the U.S. securities regulator, has launched an inquiry into how Citigroup, JPMorgan Chase, Morgan Stanley and others offer stock ratings and research, The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, the U.S. securities regulator, has launched an inquiry into how Citigroup, JPMorgan Chase, Morgan Stanley and others offer stock ratings and research, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, the United States securities regulator, has begun an inquiry into how Citigroup, JPMorgan Chase, Morgan Stanley and others offer stock ratings and research, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Finra Said to Probe Firms’ ‘Trade Huddles’
